intro: Eirmocephala, commonly known as the "dwarf iceplant," is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers adapted to dry environments. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with thick, bluish-green leaves that store water. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in spring. Eirmocephala is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
